Bases: pypospack.potential.potential.Potential

embedded energy method potential

This class is for the modelling of an EAM potential

  • func_pairpotential (str) –
  • func_density (str) –
  • func_embedding (str) –
  • filename (str) –

list of str – the list of symbols

obj_pair¶

OrderedDict of PairPotential

obj_density¶

OrderedDict of EamDensityFunction

obj_embedding¶

OrderedDict of EamEmbeddingFunction

N_r¶

int – number of radial points, the distance between two atoms

r_max¶

float – the maximum distance between two atoms

r_cut¶

float – the cutoff distance between two atoms

N_rho¶

int – the number of points in the electron density evaluation

rho_max¶

float – the maximum electron density

pypospack.potential.eamdens_expoential module¶

class pypospack.potential.eamdens_expoential.ExponentialDensityFunction(symbols)[source]¶

Bases: pypospack.potential.eam_density_function.EamDensityFunction

Parameters:symbols (list of str) –
symbols¶

list of str

potential_type¶

str – This is set to ‘eamembed_universal’

parameter_names¶

list of str

parameters¶

OrderedDict – The key is the symbol associated with the embedding function. On initialization, the value of each parameter is set to None.

density¶

OrderedDict – The key is the symbol associated with the embedding function.

N_r¶

int

d_r¶

float

r_max¶

float

r¶

numpy.ndarray

evaluate(r, parameters, r_cut=None)[source]¶

Given a vector of interatomic distances, r, passed in as variable r, and the associated parameters of the potential. This method sets the density attribute.

Parameters:
  • r (numpy.ndarray) – This should be named as rho because it represents the electron density being evaluated.
  • parameters (OrderedDict) – This is a dictionary of the parameters of the embedding function for each atom. The key is a string containing the ISO chemical symbol of the element. The value should be a numeric value.
  • r_cut (float) – This would be the density cutoff. However the embedding energy is increasing with increasing electron density so the a r_cut has no physical meaning. Any variable passed into r_cut will be ignored.

  • rho_cut (float) – This would be the density cutoff. However the embedding energy is increasing with increasing electron density so the a r_cut has no physical meaning. Any variable passed into r_cut will be ignored.

pypospack.potential.eamembed_eos_rose module¶

class pypospack.potential.eamembed_eos_rose.RoseEquationOfStateEmbeddingFunction(symbols, obj_density_function=None, obj_pair_function=None, lattice_type=None, lattice_a0=None, parameters=None)[source]¶

Bases: pypospack.potential.eam_embedding_eos.EamEmbeddingEquationOfState

An equation of state defined by the Rose Equation of the State

This class implements the determination of the embedding function by inverse solution of the Rose-Vinet Equation of State[1]. This method is outlined in by Foiles[1].

Parameters:
  • symbols (list of str) – a list of symbols.
  • obj_density_function (EamDensityFunction,optional) – an object which is an instance of the eam density function.
  • obj_pair_function (PairPotential,optional) – an object which is an instance of a pair potential.
  • lattice_type (str,optional) – the type of metal lattice that we have, the acceptable lattice types are fcc, bcc, and hcp.
  • lattice_a0 (str,optional) – the lattice parameter of the lattice type referenced in lattice_type.
  • parameters (OrderedDict,optional) – the parameters to be evaluated

Notes

[1] Foiles, Baskes, and Daw., Phys. Rev. B., 1986 [2] Brent, R. P., Algorithms for Minimization Without Derivatives. Englewood Cliffs, NJ: Prentice-Hall, 1973. Ch. 3-4

equation_of_state(rho, parameters=None)[source]¶
evaluate(rho, r, parameters, o_pair=None, o_density=None, a_min=0.0, a_max=10000.0, a_tol=1e-08)[source]¶

  • parameters (OrderedDict) – an dictionary of parameter values and keys
  • r_cut (float,optional) – the global cutoff for the potential

Given a vector of electron densities, rho, passed in as variable r, and the associated parameters of the potential. This method sets the embedding attribute.

Parameters:
  • rho (numpy.ndarray) – This should be named as rho because it represents the electron density being evaluated.
  • parameters (OrderedDict) – This is a dictionary of the parameters of the embedding function for each atom. The key is a string containing the ISO chemical symbol of the element. The value should be a numeric value.

pypospack.potential.eamembed_eos_zopemishin.func_zopemishin_eos(rho, E0, r0, alpha, beta)[source]¶

functio for the Zope Mishin equation of state :param rho: either a float or an array of electron density values :type rho: np.ndarray :param E0: a parameter :type E0: float :param r0: another parameter :type r0: float :param alpha: yet another parameter :type alpha: float :param beta: the final parameter :type beta: float

Returns:the array of values of the embedding function
Return type:np.ndarray

implements Foiles-style embeding function (i.e. density and pair potential forced to match Rose EOS) parameter list: p[0] p[1] p[2] p[3] p[4] p[5] p[6] p[7] p[8] E_coh a(morse) r0 rho0 lambda0 lambdarose De rp rd

writes the lammps_potential file

This method exists to write the lammps potential file to disk. This method needs to be overriden to be implemented, in classes that inherit from this class.

class pypospack.potential.pair_morse.MorsePotential(symbols)[source]¶

Bases: pypospack.potential.pair.PairPotential

Implementation of the morse potential

Parameters:symbols (list) – a list of chemical symbols.
evaluate(r, parameters, r_cut=None)[source]¶

evaluate the pair potential

This method evaluates the MorsePotential :param r: A numpy array of interatomic distances which to evaluate. :type r: np.ndarray :param parameters: A dictionary of parameters on which to evaluate the interatomic potential. :type parameters: OrderedDict

Notes

>>> symbols=['Ni']
>>> parameters=OrderedDict([
>>>    ('NiNi_D0',0.001114),('NiNi_a',3.429506),('NiNi_r0',2.6813)
>>>  ])
>>> o = MorsePotential(symbols = s)
>>> o.evaluate(r,testing_set['parameters'])

Module contents¶

class pypospack.potential.PotentialInformation[source]¶

Bases: object

Read/Write Empirical Interatomic Potential Information

pypospack uses yaml files to store configuration information for required for optimization routines.

filename¶

str – filename of the yaml file to read/write configuration file. Default is pypospack.potential.yaml’

elements¶

list – list of string of chemical symbols

parameter_names¶

list – list of parameter names

potential_type¶

str – type of potential

param_info¶

dict – param info

eam_pair_potential¶

str – name of the functional form for the eam pair potential. Set by default to None.

eam_embedding_function¶

str – name of the functional form the eam embedding function. Set by default to None.

eam_density_function¶

str – name of the functional form of the eam electron desnsity function. Set by default to None.

check()[source]¶

performs sanity checks to potential configuration

doe the following checks: 1. check to see if the potential type is supported.

Raises:ValueError – if the potential type is unsupported
free_parameter_names¶
get_potential_dict()[source]¶
read(filename=None)[source]¶

read potential information from yaml file

Parameters:fname (str) – file to yaml file from. If no argument is passed then use the filename attribute. If the filename is set, then the filename attribute is also set
write(filename=None, potential_configuration=None)[source]¶

write potential information from yaml file

Parameters:filename (str) – file to potential to. If no argument is passed then use the filename attribute. If the filename is set, then the filename atribute is also set.

pypospack.potential.func_cutoff(r, rcut, h)[source]¶
pypospack.potential.get_potential_map()[source]¶

get the potential map

Support for interatomic potentials requires a mapping from the potential formalism to the class supporting the function. Additional potentials to be supported can either be added here, or provided using any module available on the PYTHONPATH.

Returns:the key is the name of the potential formalism, the value is a list where the first element contains the module. second element contains the class supporting the function
Return type:(dict)
pypospack.potential.get_supported_potentials()[source]¶
